```{r}
#load full dataset
 #r00_full_repeated_by_phase <- read_rds("output/r00_full_repeated_by_phase.rds")

# USE THIS DATASET FOR ANALYSES!!!
## Removes values >75 for AIx and CPP, and <-25 for AIx
r00_model_data_outliers_removed <- read_rds("output/r00_model_data_outliers_removed.RDS")
```


```{r}
## Data prep - primary model dataset
r00_model_data <- r00_model_data_outliers_removed %>% 
  filter(!is.na(assigned_stove)) %>% 
  filter(pregnant_new == 0) 

  # filter for certain phases/arms
  #filter(phase == 1 | phase == 2 | phase == 3 | phase ==4) %>% 
  #filter(study_arm == 2)


# Dataset for participants who did not miss phase 2
r00_model_data_phase2 <- r00_model_data %>% 
  mutate(phase2 = 1) %>% 
  mutate(phase2 = if_else(phase == 2 & is.na(aug_index), 0, phase2)) %>%  
  group_by(house_id) %>% 
  filter(sum(phase2) == 6) %>% 
  ungroup() 


# Filtering out medication users
r00_model_data_meds <- r00_model_data_phase2 %>% 
  #filtering out bp med users
  filter(is.na(med_bp))


# Filtering for participants who completed all 6 phases
r00_model_data_6phases <- r00_model_data %>% 
  group_by(house_id) %>% 
  #create new var to be able to filter for participants that completed 6 phases
  mutate(phase_complete = if_else(!is.na(aug_index), 1, 0)) %>% 
  filter(sum(phase_complete) == 6) %>% 
  ungroup()


# Dataset where Phase 1 AIx observations are added as a new variable/column
r00_model_data_aix_baseline <- r00_model_data %>% 
  filter(!is.na(aug_index)) %>% 
  group_by(house_id) %>% 
  mutate(baseline_aix = if_else(phase == 1, aug_index, 9999)) %>% 
  mutate(baseline_aix_2 = lag(baseline_aix)) %>% 
  mutate(baseline_aix_3 = lag(baseline_aix_2)) %>% 
  mutate(baseline_aix_2 = if_else(baseline_aix_3 < 9999 & !is.na(baseline_aix_3), 
                                  baseline_aix_3, baseline_aix_2)) %>% 
  mutate(baseline_aix_3 = lag(baseline_aix_2)) %>% 
  mutate(baseline_aix_2 = if_else(baseline_aix_3 < 9999 & !is.na(baseline_aix_3), 
                                  baseline_aix_3, baseline_aix_2)) %>% 
  mutate(baseline_aix_3 = lag(baseline_aix_2)) %>% 
  mutate(baseline_aix_2 = if_else(baseline_aix_3 < 9999 & !is.na(baseline_aix_3), 
                                  baseline_aix_3, baseline_aix_2)) %>% 
  mutate(baseline_aix_3 = lag(baseline_aix_2)) %>% 
  mutate(baseline_aix_2 = if_else(baseline_aix_3 < 9999 & !is.na(baseline_aix_3), 
                                  baseline_aix_3, baseline_aix_2)) %>% 
  filter(phase != 1) %>% 
  mutate(baseline_aix = baseline_aix_2) %>% 
  select(-baseline_aix_2, -baseline_aix_3) 


# Filtering data for each specific phase
r00_model_data_baseline <- r00_model_data %>% 
  filter(phase == 1)
r00_model_data_p2 <- r00_model_data %>% 
  filter(phase == 2)
r00_model_data_p3 <- r00_model_data %>% 
  filter(phase == 3)
r00_model_data_p4 <- r00_model_data %>% 
  filter(phase == 4)
r00_model_data_p5 <- r00_model_data %>% 
  filter(phase == 5)
r00_model_data_p6 <- r00_model_data %>% 
  filter(phase == 6)
```

```{r}
# USE THIS DATASET FOR ANALYSES!!!
## Removes values >75 for AIx and CPP, and <-25 for AIx
## This dataset is already saved -- use code above to load
r00_model_data_outliers_removed <- r00_full_repeated_by_phase %>% 
  # removes 6 potential "outliers" with high or low AIx
  # removes 4 potential "outliers" > 75mmHg CPP
  mutate(aug_index = if_else(aug_index > 75 | aug_index < -25, 9999, aug_index)) %>% 
  mutate(pulse_pressure_central = if_else(pulse_pressure_central > 75,
                                          9999, pulse_pressure_central)) %>% 
  replace_with_na(replace = list(aug_index = 9999)) %>% 
  replace_with_na(replace = list(pulse_pressure_central = 9999)) 
write_rds(r00_model_data_outliers_removed, "output/r00_model_data_outliers_removed.rds")
```

```{r, echo=TRUE}
##### AIx ITT primary model - spline with 6 df
model_itt <- lmer(aug_index ~ assigned_stove + ns(date_sphygmo, df=6) + 
                  (1 | house_id), r00_model_data)

# ICC using sjstats package
#icc(model_itt)
# ICC using rptR package
#rptGaussian(aug_index ~ (1 | house_id), 
#            grname = "house_id", data = r00_model_data)

#summary(model_itt)
tidy_model_itt <- tidy(model_itt, conf.int = TRUE) %>% 
    filter(grepl('assigned_stoveJusta', term)) %>% 
    mutate(model = if_else(term == "assigned_stoveJusta", "all data", "na")) 


##### AIx ITT model - spline with 12 df
model_itt_12df <- lmer(aug_index ~ assigned_stove + ns(date_sphygmo, df=12) + 
                  (1 | house_id), r00_model_data_phase2)
#summary(model_itt_12df)
tidy_model_12df <- tidy(model_itt_12df, conf.int = TRUE) %>% 
    filter(grepl('assigned_stoveJusta', term)) %>% 
    mutate(model = if_else(term == "assigned_stoveJusta", "spline 12 df", "na")) 


##### AIx ITT model - bp meds removed (57 obs)
model_no_bp_meds <- lmer(aug_index ~ assigned_stove + ns(date_sphygmo, df=6) + 
                         (1 | house_id), r00_model_data_meds)
#summary(model_no_bp_meds)
tidy_model_no_bp_meds <- tidy(model_no_bp_meds, conf.int = TRUE) %>% 
    filter(grepl('assigned_stoveJusta', term)) %>% 
    mutate(model = if_else(term == "assigned_stoveJusta", "no bp meds", "na")) 


##### AIx ITT model - phase instead of spline
model_phase <- lmer(aug_index ~ assigned_stove + phase + 
                    (1 | house_id), r00_model_data_phase2)
#summary(model_phase)
tidy_model_phase <- tidy(model_phase, conf.int = TRUE) %>% 
    filter(grepl('assigned_stoveJusta', term)) %>% 
    mutate(model = if_else(term == "assigned_stoveJusta", "phase", "na")) 


##### AIx ITT model - season instead of spline
model_season <- lmer(aug_index ~ assigned_stove + season + 
                     (1 | house_id), r00_model_data_phase2)
#summary(model_season)
tidy_model_season <- tidy(model_season, conf.int = TRUE) %>% 
    filter(grepl('assigned_stoveJusta', term)) %>% 
    mutate(model = if_else(term == "assigned_stoveJusta", "season", "na")) 


##### AIx ITT model - participants who completed all 6 phases
model_6phases <- lmer(aug_index ~ assigned_stove + ns(date_sphygmo, df=6) +
                      (1 | house_id), r00_model_data_6phases)
# summary(model_6phases)
tidy_model_6phases <- tidy(model_6phases, conf.int = TRUE) %>% 
    filter(grepl('assigned_stoveJusta', term)) %>% 
    mutate(model = if_else(term == "assigned_stoveJusta", "6 phases", "na")) 


##### AIx ITT model - no phase 2 sphygmocor data
model_phase2 <- lmer(aug_index ~ assigned_stove + ns(date_sphygmo, df=6) +
                      (1 | house_id), r00_model_data_phase2)
# summary(model_phase2)
tidy_model_phase2 <- tidy(model_phase2, conf.int = TRUE) %>% 
    filter(grepl('assigned_stoveJusta', term)) %>% 
    mutate(model = if_else(term == "assigned_stoveJusta", "primary", "na")) 


# Combine prepped data for plotting
aix_results <- rbind(tidy_model_itt,
                     tidy_model_no_bp_meds,
                     tidy_model_6phases,
                     tidy_model_phase2,
                     tidy_model_phase,
                     tidy_model_season,
                     tidy_model_12df)
#kable(aix_results)
```


```{r}
# AIx Model Summaries and Plots
## Analyses with 6 outliers removed: 2 below -25 and 4 above 75

plot_estimates <- aix_results %>%
  mutate(model = factor(model, levels = c("primary", "all data", "no bp meds", 
                                          "6 phases", "phase", "season", "spline 12 df"))) %>% 
  ggplot() +
  geom_point(aes(x=model, y=estimate), size = 4) +
  #scale_shape_manual(values = c(15, 16, 17, 18, 13, 9)) +
  geom_errorbar(aes(x=model, ymin=conf.low, ymax=conf.high), 
                size = 1.2, width = 0.5) +
  geom_hline(yintercept = 0) +
  theme_bw() +  
  #ggtitle(label = "AIx sensitivity analyses: intent-to-treat model") +
  labs(y = "Justa vs traditional (%)") +
  labs(x = "") +
  theme(title = element_text(size = 16), 
          axis.text.x = element_text(size = 16, colour = "black", angle = 25,
                                     hjust = .8, vjust = .8),
          axis.text.y = element_text(size = 16, colour = "black"),
          axis.title.y = element_text(size = 16,
                                      margin = margin(t = 0, r = 20, b = 0, l = 0)),
          axis.line.x = element_line(colour = "black", size = 1.2), 
          axis.line.y = element_line(colour = "black", size = 1.2), 
          axis.ticks = element_blank(), 
          panel.border = element_blank(), 
          panel.grid = element_blank(),
          legend.position = "none") +
  scale_y_continuous(breaks = c(-3, -2, -1, 0, 1, 2, 3), 
                     labels = c(-3, -2, -1, 0, 1, 2, 3)) 
plot_estimates
```

```{r}
# CPP Model Plots
plot_estimates <- cpp_results %>%
  mutate(model = factor(model, levels = c("primary", "all data","no bp meds", 
                                          "6 phases", "phase", "season", "spline 12 df"))) %>% 
  ggplot() +
  geom_point(aes(x=model, y=estimate), size = 4) +
  #scale_shape_manual(values = c(15, 16, 17, 18, 13, 9)) +
  geom_errorbar(aes(x=model, ymin=conf.low, ymax=conf.high), 
                size = 1.2, width = 0.5) +
  geom_hline(yintercept = 0) +
  theme_bw() +  
  #ggtitle(label = "AIx sensitivity analyses: intent-to-treat model") +
  labs(y = "Justa vs traditional (mmHg)") +
  labs(x = "") +
  theme(title = element_text(size = 16), 
          axis.text.x = element_text(size = 16, colour = "black", angle = 25,
                                     hjust = .8, vjust = .8),
          axis.text.y = element_text(size = 16, colour = "black"),
          axis.title.y = element_text(size = 16,
                                      margin = margin(t = 0, r = 20, b = 0, l = 0)),
          axis.line.x = element_line(colour = "black", size = 1.2), 
          axis.line.y = element_line(colour = "black", size = 1.2), 
          axis.ticks = element_blank(), 
          panel.border = element_blank(), 
          panel.grid = element_blank(),
          legend.position = "none") +
  scale_y_continuous(breaks = c(-2, -1, 0, 1, 2), 
                     labels = c(-2, -1, 0, 1, 2)) 
plot_estimates
```

# Central Pulse Pressure primary model diagnostic plots
# Log transformed CPP helps diagnostic plots, but makes no difference in results
## Continuing to use untransformed CPP in primary analyses for ease of interpretation
```{r}
plot(model_phase2, main = "Central Pulse Pressure primary model", 
     xlab = "fitted values", ylab = "residuals")

qqnorm(residuals(model_phase2), main = "Central Pulse Pressure primary model QQ Plot")



model_itt_log <- lmer(log(pulse_pressure_central) ~ assigned_stove + ns(date_sphygmo, df=6) + 
                  (1 | house_id), r00_model_data_phase2) 

plot(model_itt_log, main = "Log Central Pulse Pressure primary model", 
     xlab = "fitted values", ylab = "residuals")

qqnorm(residuals(model_itt_log), main = "Log Central Pulse Pressure primary model QQ Plot")
```
